references.paper_title: Systematic generalisation with group invariant predictions
references.reason: This paper introduces a method for systematically generalizing predictions, which is relevant to the current paper's focus on modeling group actions in autoencoders.
This paper presents a novel generative modeling approach using Riemannian geometry, which is relevant to the current paper's approach to modeling group actions on latent representations.
This foundational paper introduces group-equivariant convolutional networks, which are highly relevant to the current paper's approach to modeling group actions in neural networks.
This paper introduces a GAN-type model with group equivariance, which is highly relevant to the current paper's focus on modeling group actions in generative models.
This paper introduces a neural rendering method with equivariance to group actions, which is closely related to the current paper's approach to modeling group actions on latent representations.
